channel.title: Modules on WHMCS Developer Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Modules on WHMCS Developer Documentation

item.title: Modules
item.description:
Introduction

A module is a collection of functions that provide additional functionality to the WHMCS platform, most commonly used to integrate with third party services and APIs.

Choose a module type to begin…

Provisoning Modules

For modules that enable provisioning and management of products & services via API.

Addon Modules

Create a module that provides additional functionality within WHMCS.

Registrar Modules

Connect with domain registrars to allow for availability checking, domain registration and management.

Gateway Modules

Integrate with payment gateway providers to collect and process payments.

item.title: Code Samples
item.description:
We make available sample code for each of our module types via Github.

  • Sample Gateway Module - https://github.com/WHMCS/sample-gateway-module
  • Sample Merchant Gateway - https://github.com/WHMCS/sample-merchant-gateway
  • Sample Provisioning Module - https://github.com/WHMCS/sample-provisioning-module
  • Sample Domain Registrar Module - https://github.com/WHMCS/sample-registrar-module
  • Sample Addon Module - https://github.com/WHMCS/sample-addon-module

item.title: Marketplace
item.description:
The WHMCS Marketplace allows users of WHMCS to connect with, find and discover add-ons and extensions for the WHMCS platform.

For developers, it provides a great opportunity for you to get your creations exposure and visibility to potential users and customers.

Submission is free, and we highly recommend submitting your creations to it.

For more information, please visit https://marketplace.whmcs.com
